prompt: <description>Part 1 The first part is a slightly tilted three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The base of this prism is constructed by drawing lines on a plane in the following sequence: 1. Draw a line (line\\_1) from coordinates (0.0, 0.0) to (0.587, 0.0). 2. Draw a line (line\\_2) from coordinates (0.587, 0.0) to (0.587, 0.2853). 3. Draw a line (line\\_3) from coordinates (0.587, 0.2853) to (0.0, 0.2853). 4. Draw a line (line\\_4) from coordinates (0.0, 0.2853) back to the start point (0.0, 0.0). After drawing the lines, use the `sketch_scale` parameter of `0.587` to scale the base sketch. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the Euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and the translate vector (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). Extrude the 2D sketch by `0.75` units in the normal direction to create the prism with the following dimensions: `length = 0.587`, `width = 0.587`, and `height = 0.75`. Part 2 The second part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The base of this prism is constructed by drawing lines on a plane in the following sequence: 1. Draw a line (line\\_1) from coordinates (0.0, 0.0) to (0.5543, 0.0). 2. Draw a line (line\\_2) from coordinates (0.5543, 0.0) to (0.5543, 0.7174). 3. Draw a line (line\\_3) from coordinates (0.5543, 0.7174) to (0.0, 0.7174). 4. Draw a line (line\\_4) from coordinates (0.0, 0.7174) back to the start point (0.0, 0.0). After drawing the lines, use the `sketch_scale` parameter of `0.7174` to scale the base sketch. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the Euler angles (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and the translate vector (0.0163, 0.0, 0.0163). Instead of extruding, apply a cut feature operation with 0 as the towards normal depth and `0.0245` units in the opposite direction of the normal. This will create a prism with the following dimensions: `length = 0.7174`, `width = 0.0245`, and `height = 0.7174`.</description>
